message: On Veterans Day, we pause and say thank you to the men and women who answered America’s call to service.
Wishing you and your family a Happy Thanksgiving. As we reflect on our many blessings, may it be a special time surrounded by those you love most.
Wishing you and yours a healthy, prosperous, and happy New Year.
Sunny, blue sky, 37 degrees makes for a great first ride of 2017! Happy New Year!
NA
I'm deeply honored to once again have the opportunity to serve Michigan's 7th District and bring your voice and values to the halls of Congress.

Some good news for Michigan taxpayers in the first week of the new Congress. The Taxpayers Right-To-Know Act, my bill to shine light on wasteful federal spending, passed the House today. http://go.usa.gov/x928C

I'm honored to join the House Committee on Energy and Commerce this Congress. The Committee has broad jurisdiction over issues of great importance to Michigan families and all Americans, and I'm excited to get to work on solutions to tackle our nation's most pressing challenges.

The recent anti-Israel resolution at the United Nations was a shameful conclusion to eight years of the Obama administration’s disastrous foreign policy. It only undermined our close, democratic ally and the possibility of peace. Tonight, in a strong bipartisan fashion, the House voted to condemn these actions and stand shoulder to shoulder with Israel.

The men and women in law enforcement deserve our deepest gratitude for all they do to keep our communities safe. Each day when they walk out the door, they risk their lives to protect ours. I encourage people in Michigan and across the country to show their support for law enforcement today—wear blue clothing, display a blue light, or say a simple word of thanks to a police officer in your neighborhood.
This week kicks off the North American International Auto Show in Detroit. And as a car guy all my life, I never miss the world’s premier automotive event.

Today I introduced bipartisan legislation with Rep. Debbie Dingell to increase transparency at VA hospitals, and help ensure our nation’s veterans receive the highest quality care in a timely fashion.
It was great to be at the Detroit River International Wildlife Refuge today for a ceremony to name the visitors center the John D Dingell Jr. Visitor Center.
Today we honor the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his courage and commitment to freedom, justice, and opportunity.
Great to see more positive news for Michigan jobs and manufacturing.

Manning was convicted of stealing and distributing highly sensitive military secrets, putting American lives and national security at risk. This commutation is totally egregious and puts politics above security.

The stage is set for tomorrow's inauguration ceremonies where we will witness the peaceful transition of power. It's been great to welcome so many Michigan families who are visiting our nation's capital this week to attend the inauguration.

It was an honor to join with Americans from across the country today to witness democracy in action. With the peaceful transfer of power now complete, it is time to work together to chart a new course and build a brighter future for our children and grandchildren.

Through its career and technical education programs, the LISD TECH Center does tremendous work preparing students for success in the workplace. Glad to be in Adrian today to recognize the Tech Center's many contributions to the community.

Moving forward with the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines is welcome news for American workers. Construction of these infrastructure projects will put more Americans back to work, bolster our nation’s long-term energy security, and boost economic growth.
Exciting things happening at the LISD TECH Center to prepare students for job opportunities in the skilled trades.
On this day in 1837, Michigan became our nation's 26th state. Happy 180th birthday, Michigan!

As National School Choice Week comes to a close, may we continue working to provide every child, no matter where they are from, with access to a quality education and an opportunity to pursue their dreams.

Judge Neil Gorsuch is a distinguished jurist with a sterling legal mind. Throughout his career, he has earned a reputation as a steadfast and intellectual defender of the Constitution and the rule of law. Judge Gorsuch is an excellent selection to follow in the philosophical tradition of Justice Scalia on the Supreme Court.
Michigan is on the forefront of automotive and technological innovation, and with new investments like General Motors and Honda announced earlier this week, we will continue to lead the way.
Had a great time last night in Saline at Snowblast 2017 to support the Foundation for Saline Area Schools.

Technology has advanced dramatically in the last 30 years and our obsolete digital privacy laws need to be modernized for the 21st century. The Email Privacy Act, which passed the House tonight with my support, protects the American people's constitutional rights and requires the government to obtain a warrant in order to access an individual's emails.

At today's House Committee on Education and the Workforce hearing, we discussed ways to strengthen the workforce and close the skills gap by improving collaboration between employers and higher education institutions. http://go.usa.gov/x9Fzu

Inspired by my conversation with members of Srsly Chelsea and Srsly Dexter. These young people are leaders in their schools and are doing exemplary work to educate their peers and help prevent substance abuse in their communities.
Good discussion at today's ShopTalk meeting with Lenawee County farmers about MAEAP and conservation best practices.

Obtaining a degree provides such a valuable foundation for our children’s future and a successful career. My bipartisan bill, recently introduced with Rep. Dan Kildee, will give families increased opportunities to save for and afford the rising cost of education.

Enjoyed meeting with Monroe County Community College, Jackson College, Lansing Community College, and Washtenaw Community College this week to discuss the important role community colleges play in preparing students for future careers.

Today I helped introduce the Small Business Health Fairness Act to empower small businesses to provide their employees greater access to quality, affordable health care. It’s another step in delivering the patient-centered health care solutions the American people deserve.
Today we celebrate George Washington and those who have served in our nation's highest office. Happy Presidents' Day.

Proper disposal of old and unwanted prescription drugs is one important way we can help combat this epidemic affecting our communities. Grateful for these drop off locations in Monroe County and many others across the 7th District.

This February, we recognize Career and Technical Education Month, and the important real world experience CTE programs provide today's students as they prepare for tomorrow's jobs. In the 7th District, we are fortunate to have places like the Southern Michigan Center for Science and Industry in Hudson, Monroe County Community College, the Jackson Area Career Center, and many more schools that help students learn in-demand skills.

As we work to repair our broken health care system, one important component is maintaining protections for patients with pre-existing conditions. That's why I'm a co-sponsor of H.R. 1121, the Pre-Existing Conditions Protection Act. http://go.usa.gov/x9hKC

I'm honored to have Mike Hirst from Jackson as my guest at tomorrow's joint address to Congress. Through his work speaking at schools and forums, counseling addicts, and supporting families, Mike has been a tireless and compassionate advocate for raising awareness about the dangers of drug addiction and offering a helping hand to those in need.

Tonight, the President outlined positive solutions to tackle a number of critical issues facing our country. To grow a healthy economy, we need to roll back costly regulations and overhaul the tax code to incentivize investments and more good-paying jobs here at home. Too many families are struggling with skyrocketing health care costs, and we need a new patient-centered approach that lowers costs and expands access to quality, affordable health care options. Protecting our national security and taking care of our veterans when they return from the battlefield is a solemn responsibility and must also be a top priority. Important work lies ahead to address these and other pressing challenges, and I’m committed to working with the President and my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to create a safer and more prosperous future for every American.

At today's House Committee on Education and the Workforce hearing, we discussed my bill, the Small Business Health Fairness Act, that will empower small businesses to provide employees better health care at lower costs. https://go.usa.gov/xX3Ea
Good news: The Regulatory Integrity Act, my bipartisan bill to bring more transparency to regulatory process, passed the House today.

Thanks to everyone who joined me for coffee hour this morning at Hillsdale City Hall. I appreciate the opportunity to hear your concerns and answer your questions. Look forward to continuing to do more across the 7th District.
I'm proud to be on this list of the top 10 town hall holders in all of Congress.

On Black Balloon Overdose Awareness Day, we remember those in our community who lost their life to drug addiction. Today, along with Jackson County Sheriff Steve Rand and Mike Hirst from Andy's Angels, I spoke with inmates at the Jackson County Jail and visited the Jackson Recovery Resource Center. Working together in our community, we can continue to raise awareness about the opioid epidemic and support those on the path to recovery.

Obamacare hasn’t worked as promised, and as a result, too many families have seen costs soar, quality drop, and choices reduced. The American Health Care Act is a patient-centered approach that will bring down costs, increase choice and competition, and put families back in control of their care. It protects patients with pre-existing conditions and provides a stable transition to a better health care system. This is one of many steps the House will be taking to make health care work for all Americans. You can read the entire bill online at http://readthebill.gop.

Two committees that I serve on are marking up legislative proposals today to expand access to affordable, dependable, and high quality health care.  The Education and the Workforce Committee will be considering my bill, the Small Business Health Fairness Act, which empowers small businesses to band together through association health plans to negotiate for lower health insurance costs on behalf of their employees. You can watch it live here: https://go.usa.gov/xXavN.  The Energy and Commerce Committee will be marking up the American Health Care Act, which advances patient-centered solutions that will bring down costs, increase choice and competition, and put families back in control of their care. You can watch it live here: https://go.usa.gov/xXav5.  Today's hearings are just one of many steps the House will be taking in an open and transparent way to make health care work for all Americans.

I encourage you to watch Speaker Ryan's presentation on the American Health Care Act. He provides an in-depth explanation about the step-by-step plan to expand access to affordable, high quality health care for all Americans.
Great to see these jobs are coming back to the GM Delta Township Plant.

It's always a highlight to talk with students from around the 7th District, and today's visit with a great group of students from Clinton Community Schools was no exception. Enjoy the rest of your trip!

This week, Rep. Debbie Dingell and I introduced "Jessie's Law," legislation named after a young woman living in Michigan who tragically died last year of an opioid overdose. As we continue fighting back against this deadly epidemic, this bipartisan bill will help prevent another tragedy like Jessie's.
I'm working with Senator Rand Paul and a bipartisan group of lawmakers to curb civil asset forfeiture abuse and protect property rights. Learn more about the FAIR Act that we introduced this week. ⬇️
Thank you to everyone who joined us for coffee hour this morning at the LISD TECH Center in Adrian.
Good to be at the Lily Missions Center in Jackson today for their breast cancer awareness and screening event. Thanks to Pastor Hines for hosting.
NA
Started off the week with a coffee hour this morning at the Chelsea American Legion. Thank you to everyone who attended.
Happy National Agriculture Day to all of the farmers in Michigan who work hard each day to put food on our tables.

In Michigan and across the country there's been a surge of fentanyl, a synthetic opioid that is 50 times more potent than heroin. At a House Committee on Energy and Commerce hearing, we examined ways to bolster our response to this growing crisis. https://go.usa.gov/xXkjv

When it comes to accessing high quality health care coverage, small businesses should not be treated any differently than large corporations and unions. My bipartisan bill, which passed the House today, will level the playing field for small businesses and empower them to band together to provide better coverage at lower cost for their workers.
Had a great time at last night's Monroe Ducks Unlimited dinner with my fellow outdoorsmen and women.
More encouraging news for Michigan jobs and our state's continued leadership in car manufacturing and innovation.
It was great to see Tammi Carr and her family this morning before she testified in front of Congress about The ChadTough Foundation and the importance of cancer research.

Good meeting today with health care professionals to discuss providing quality, affordable care to communities across the 7th District. Thank you to the Center for Family Health in Jackson and Hillsdale Counties, Cherry Health in Eaton County, and Family Medical Center of Michigan in Monroe and Lenawee Counties.
Thanks to everyone who joined us for coffee hour this morning at Michigan's Grand Army of the Republic Memorial Hall and Museum in Eaton Rapids.
Had a great day meeting with folks across Eaton County.
It was an honor to be at the Lions Club district convention today in Jackson to pay tribute to those who serve our country and present Vietnam veterans with their 50th anniversary lapel pins.

It was inspiring to meet Brandon Martz and his family from Jackson County today. With the help of the Dream Foundation, which fulfill dreams for terminally-ill young people and adults, Brandon and his family are visiting our nation's capital and raising awareness about Duchenne muscular dystrophy. It was an honor to be part of helping turn his dream into reality. Learn more about Brandon's story here: https://go.usa.gov/xXnhU.

Yesterday, I spoke in support of the Self-Insurance Protection Act, which passed the House by a vote of 400 to 16. Over 60 percent of employers who offer health care coverage utilize self-insured plans, and this bipartisan bill will help ensure workers and families can continue to receive these flexible, affordable health care options. https://go.usa.gov/xXQEj

Using chemical weapons against your own people—brutally murdering innocent children and civilians—is the very definition of barbarism. Last night’s missile strike against the Syrian airbase used to launch the chemical weapons attack was a decisive and targeted response. It puts the Assad regime on notice that these unimaginable acts of evil cannot continue and will not be tolerated. Moving forward, it is important the Administration work with Congress and our allies to develop a long-term strategy for Syria and the region.
Great to be in Monroe County today for a coffee hour in Luna Pier. Thanks to everyone who came out.
What a moving visit this week with Brandon from Jackson County to help fulfill his dream trip. WLNS-TV captured his story.
Calling all high school students in Michigan's 7th District interested in participating in the Congressional Art Competition. My office is now accepting submissions.

Regulatory reform is a key component to more robust job creation and economic growth. Read my latest column in the Jackson Citizen Patriot about our work to roll back heavy-handed federal regulations.

Pinwheel for Prevention gardens are being planted across Monroe County in April to raise awareness for Child Abuse Prevention Month. Thank you to Craig Haugen and the Child Advocacy Network for the important work you do on behalf of children and families in our community.
Let's hope this finally brings some justice for the family of Brian Terry.
Sue and I are beyond blessed to welcome another grandchild. One of many selfies to come with grandpa and Hannah Belle.
Wishing you and your family a happy and most blessed Easter.

This week is National Park Week, and in the 7th District, we are fortunate to have the River Raisin National Battlefield Park right here in Monroe County. If you've never been, I encourage you to visit this historical site and learn more about the War of 1812 and this important chapter in American history.

Pointe Mouillee is a beautiful spot on the shores of Lake Erie in Monroe County. With the help of the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative and Ducks Unlimited, a restoration project is underway to protect the area's wetlands and wildlife habitats. It's one of the many reasons why the GLRI has received widespread bipartisan support and needs to be preserved.

April is Donate Life Month, which raises awareness about the potential to save and heal lives through organ, tissue, and eye donation. Watch this video to learn more about joining Michigan's organ donor registry.

It's always a highlight to welcome families from across the 7th District to the nation's capital. Here are some of our recent office visitors. If you're planning a trip to DC this spring or summer, my staff can help with scheduling tours: http://walberg.house.gov/howmayiserveyou/visitdc.htm

The web of occupational licensing requirements are some of the most burdensome obstacles for aspiring workers and entrepreneurs. Today I introduced a bipartisan bill to help reduce unnecessary barriers for those seeking to enter the workforce.
This Saturday is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day. If you have any expired or unwanted prescription drugs, you can safely dispose of them at locations around the 7th District.
The House just passed the Working Families Flexibility Act, a commonsense bill to empower workers with more options to balance work, life, and family.
Check out my latest column in the Monroe News about the steps we're taking to continue to bolster the federal response to the heroin and opioid epidemic.

Obamacare is on the brink of collapse and has failed to live up to its many promises. We told our constituents we would fix the mess Obamacare created, and this legislation is an important step towards undoing the damage and providing relief.
Today the House also passed H.R. 2192, which requires Congress to live under the American Health Care Act. There should be no exemptions for Members of Congress and their staff.
In this op-ed, my colleague Congresswoman Cathy McMorris Rodgers explains how the American Health Care Act protects people with pre-existing conditions, like her son Cole who has Down syndrome.

Enjoyed being at today's Monroe County Chamber of Commerce legislative luncheon. Spoke and answered questions about fixing our health care system, reforming the tax code, protecting the Great Lakes, and many other important issues to our community.
It is exciting to see Toyota continue to invest, innovate, and create jobs in Washtenaw County. Congratulations on the new expansion!

As a member of the Education and the Workforce Committee, I'm committed to advancing policies to close the skills gap and help prepare students for in-demand jobs. This recently introduced bipartisan legislation to strengthen career and technical education is an important part of that effort.
We will not forget those who paid the ultimate sacrifice serving our community.
Just wrapped up a coffee hour in Jackson this morning. Thanks to everyone who attended and to Mindy Bradish-Orta, President of the Jackson Chamber, for serving as the moderator.
NA

Teamed up with Google today to deliver the Online Safety Roadshow at Charlotte Middle School. It was a fun assembly and opportunity to teach the students how to develop smart and safe internet habits.
Wishing a happy Mother’s Day to my wife Sue and all the moms who sacrifice so much for our families. We love and appreciate you.
NA
It was an honor to give the commencement address today at Spring Arbor University and share a word of encouragement with the graduates. Congratulations to the Class of 2017!

On Peace Officers Memorial Day, families, friends, and fellow officers from across the country gathered at the U.S. Capitol today to remember the law enforcement officers who lost their lives in the line of duty this past year. It is a particularly solemn time for the Branch County community, as Sheriff Deputy Michael Winter was one of the names of the fallen etched into the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial.
Thanks to Saline Lectronics, Inc. for showing me around your manufacturing facility today. It's always great to see Michigan manufacturers doing innovative work in our community.
This Saturday, the Jackson Police Department and Henry Ford Allegiance Health are holding a free event for the community to safely dispose of unwanted, expired, or unused medications.

Today, I spoke on the House floor to honor the memory of Branch County Sheriff Posse Deputy Michael Winter, who lost his life in the line of duty. This week, during National Police Week, Deputy Winter's name was carved into the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial in Washington, DC.
I authored legislation to restore important retirement protections that workers have counted on for decades, and I'm proud that the President has now signed it into law.

Yesterday, the Education and the Workforce Committee advanced the Strengthening Career and Technical Education for the 21st Century Act. This bipartisan bill will help prepare more students for success in workplace, and I'm glad to see it move a step closer towards passing the House.
It was great to visit with students from Hudson Middle School in Lenawee County this week during their trip to our nation's capital.
On Armed Forces Day, we thank and honor the brave men and women who serve our country.

It was a privilege to present The Congressional Award to Amanda Coy today at Saline High School and celebrate her hard work to better herself and the community. To receive this medal, Amanda spent hundreds of hours serving the community, doing volunteer work, and meeting personal development goals. Congratulations, Amanda, on this incredible achievement!
This bipartisan bill strengthens efforts of the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children to carry out their mission.
As co-chair of the House Motorcycle Caucus and a fellow rider, I enjoyed meeting with ABATE of Michigan members today to discuss motorcycle issues.
Attention job seekers: You're invited to my annual Job Fair in Jackson on Tuesday, May 30. Local employers and organizations will be on hand to accept resumes and talk about available openings.
NA
It's great to be in Coldwater today for another coffee hour. Thanks to everyone who attended.
We owe immeasurable gratitude to our nation’s veterans, and these bills reflect a continued bipartisan commitment to the heroes who served our country.

Today, along with Branch County Sheriff John Pollack, I presented Connie Winter with a congressional record tribute to honor the memory of her husband, Sheriff Posse Deputy Michael Winter, who lost his life in the line of duty. Deputy Winter is a hero in every sense of the word. He is deeply missed, but not forgotten.
The Branch Area Careers Center is doing important work providing career and technical education and preparing students for success in the workplace. Thanks for showing me around your facility.

In Saline this morning for a Memorial Day parade and ceremony. Today we pause to remember the men and women who gave the ultimate sacrifice to protect our freedom. Their memory endures in our hearts and their heroism will not be forgotten.

Today, as we remember the fallen, a grateful nation also says thank you to the men and women, past and present, who serve our country in the military. Thanks to South Jackson Community Church for hosting a special ceremony this afternoon to pay tribute to our veterans.
We hosted our 7th annual job fair today in Jackson. Thanks to all the local employers and job seekers who attended and made it such a success.
On behalf of a grateful nation, we say thank you.

Modernizing the VA's electronic health records system will better serve our veterans and improve their access to care. Today's announcement is an important step to help bring the VA into the 21st century.
73 years ago today, on D-Day, Allied forces stormed the beaches of Normandy. We will always remember the courage and sacrifice of the Greatest Generation.

Today, the Energy and Commerce Committee approved a number of bipartisan bills, including my legislation introduced with Rep. Debbie Dingell to help ease paperwork burdens and ensure affordable energy for Michigan families. It passed unanimously. We also advanced the FDA Reauthorization Act, which will help speed up the approval process for life-saving drugs and boost medical innovation.
Blessed to be celebrating 43 years of marriage today. Happy anniversary to my wife Sue—my best friend and love of my life.

This week the Michigan delegation introduced bipartisan legislation to modernize the Soo Locks. Great Lakes shipping has a significant impact on jobs and Michigan's economy, and the Soo Locks are a critical gateway in transporting products across the entire region.
It's free fishing weekend in Michigan where anyone can fish – no license required. Enjoy the outdoors!
☑ H.R. 1109 unanimously passed the House today.

The entrenched culture problems at the VA have gone on for far too long. These bipartisan reforms will help clean up the VA and ensure America’s veterans receive high quality care worthy of their service and sacrifice.
Praying for my friend Congressman Steve Scalise, the Capitol Police, and everyone affected by this morning's horrible shooting.

Matt Mika was a former staff member during my first term in Congress and has remained a close friend ever since. Matt is a graduate of Adrian College, and as a former baseball player, he was volunteering at this morning’s practice to help the congressional team get ready for the game. This is deeply personal and Sue and I are praying for Matt as he receives medical attention.

Through my work on the Education and the Workforce Committee, I've been a longtime advocate for career and technical education and providing students with hands-on work experience. This announcement is another promising step to help increase opportunities for more Americans to succeed in the workplace.
Beautiful day for a race today at Michigan International Speedway, located in the heart of the 7th District. What a finish!

My twin brother and I were blessed with a great father who invested time into our lives from an early age. The simple things had great impact. I wish all the fathers out there a wonderful Father's Day filled with continuing impact and lifelong memories.
The spring season for high school sports wrapped up this past weekend and a number of teams from across the 7th District won state championships. Congratulations on an incredible season!
Check out my latest column in the Jackson Citizen Patriot about our bipartisan work to combat human trafficking.

Congratulations to Carly Claucherty from Springport High School for being named a Presidential Scholar in Career and Technical Education. She’s one of just 20 students from around the country to receive this distinguished award.
Received some mail from President Trump today: A signed copy of my resolution, now law, to strengthen retirement protections.
Had a great visit today with students from the Future Farmers of America chapters in Branch and Hillsdale Counties. They have a bright future ahead as our state's agriculture leaders.

Great news: Our bipartisan bill to strengthen career and technical education passed the House today. It will help more students and workers in Michigan get the hands-on experience they need to succeed in the workforce.

Invasive species like Asian carp pose a real threat to the Great Lakes ecosystem. Today’s news that one was discovered just nine miles from Lake Michigan increases the urgency to take bipartisan, commonsense steps to protect the Great Lakes. The administration should promptly release the Brandon Road Study so we can move forward with long-term solutions to combat Asian carp before it’s too late.
These bipartisan reforms will bring long-overdue accountability to the VA and make a real difference for veterans and their families. So glad to see this bill signed into law this week.
So thankful to hear this wonderful news. Welcome home, Matt!

The Army Corp of Engineers should immediately release the Brandon Road Study so we can move forward with long-term solutions to combat Asian carp. We simply cannot allow Asian carp to wreak havoc on the Great Lakes.

Today I joined with leaders of the Bipartisan Heroin Task Force to release our legislative agenda for this Congress. One key piece of our agenda is “Jessie’s Law,” a bipartisan bill I introduced earlier this year along with Rep. Debbie Dingell.

It was inspiring to meet with FIRST Robotics students from Michigan, including members of the Dexter Dreadbots. Innovative STEM programs help young people gain valuable skills and experience, and these students have a bright future ahead.

Kate Steinle’s story is both heartbreaking and preventable. We can’t bring her back, but by passing Kate’s Law, we can honor her memory and get serious about enforcing our immigration laws and keeping our communities safe.

It was a pleasure to welcome Aspen Schupbach to our nation's capital and congratulate her for winning the 2017 Congressional Art Competition. Aspen graduated from Western High School in Parma this spring and plans to attend Jackson College in the fall. She received first place for her charcoal drawing entitled “Rooted in Reality.” https://go.usa.gov/xNsvc

Had a good meeting with folks from the National Association for the Advancement of Orthotics & Prosthetics (NAAOP) this week. Grateful to have their support for the Injured and Amputee Veterans Bill of Rights, my bipartisan bill to help educate and empower the veterans with amputations and physical disabilities as they navigate the VA.

Picnics, parades, fireworks—they're all important Fourth of July traditions. As we celebrate this weekend, may we also remember the sacrifice of those who launched the American experiment and honor all the men and women who have fought to maintain our freedoms. Have a wonderful Fourth of July.
241 years ago, our forefathers declared independence and birthed a new nation on the principles of liberty and freedom. Happy Independence Day!
NA
Enjoyed speaking with fellow bikers over the weekend at the ABATE of Michigan region 13 meeting.
NA
Thanks to everyone who joined us for coffee hour today at the Saline American Legion.
Appreciate the tour from Hank and Carol of Banas Lumber. They have a great small business in Maybee.
We're live in Lansing talking Small Businesses with the Lansing Regional Chamber of Commerce. #FBBoost

Joined with Facebook and the Lansing Regional Chamber of Commerce for an event today to help small businesses learn effective digital strategies to grow and succeed. Small businesses are the foundation of a healthy economy, and it was great to see more than 300 local entrepreneurs in attendance.
Good discussion with Lyft drivers from Michigan this morning about the sharing economy.

Congratulations to these nine students from Michigan's 7th District for receiving an appointment to a U.S. military service academy. Michigan is filled with some of the best and brightest young leaders our country has to offer, and these students are shining examples of success in the classroom and in the community.  West Point  Zach Calderone – Jackson, Hanover-Horton High School  Ananth Ghosh – Chelsea, Chelsea High School Emma Lawson – Monroe, Ida High School Curtis Manore – Petersburg, Summerfield High School  Naval Academy  Jordan McGinnis – Ann Arbor, Dexter High School Anthony Stone – Lansing, Lansing Catholic High School  Air Force Academy  Isaac Coolidge – Eaton Rapids, Eaton Rapids High School  Isaac Theisen – Monroe, St. Mary Catholic Central Faith Van Havel – Hudson, Hillsdale Academy

At today's House Committee on Energy and Commerce hearing, we heard from state-level officials about ways to work together to bolster our response to the opioid epidemic. One area is the need for additional data to understand the true scope of this crisis and how to better respond. https://go.usa.gov/xNej5

Human trafficking is an unthinkable crime and more needs to be done to stop it. Today, the House passed my bipartisan bill to strengthen our ability to identify the signs of human trafficking, assist victims, and properly refer cases to law enforcement so perpetrators can be brought to justice.
Monroe County turns 200 tomorrow. I spoke on the House floor today to celebrate the bicentennial and all the special things Monroe County has to offer.
Great news: The House just passed a strong bipartisan defense bill to enhance our national security and give our troops a pay raise.
Wrote an op-ed in today's Detroit News about our bipartisan work to strengthen career and technical education to meet the demands of the 21st century workforce.
I'm hosting a Veterans Fair at VFW Post 1138 in Monroe on Friday to help veterans and their families learn more about resources available to them. Click below for more details.

I’m pleased to report the House took important action this week to crack down on the unthinkable crime of human trafficking. We passed a number of bipartisan bills, including my bill, the Enhancing Detection of Human Trafficking Act.
Happy National Ice Cream Day!

We need to rein in, not expand, asset forfeiture. Although there are legitimate uses, we've seen too many abuses of the system where due process rights have been violated and private property has been seized without charging the property owner with a crime. That's why I introduced the FAIR Act along with Senator Rand Paul. Learn more: https://go.usa.gov/xNhZb
Had a busy and productive day participating in three separate hearings on issues ranging from K-12 education policy to electricity markets and grid reliability.

Met today with Ducks Unlimited and other conservation groups about the importance of the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative. Yesterday the House took important steps to protect the GLRI and our Great Lakes by passing legislation out of committee that fully supports the program. http://detne.ws/2uvV3WZ
Had a great time at the 64th annual Manchester Chicken Broil.

Glad we could help connect so many veterans and their families with available resources at today's Monroe County Veterans Fair. It was also very special to recognize Vietnam veterans and present them with their 50th anniversary pins. Thanks to VFW Post 1138 and all the participating organizations for making it a success.
Good tour of Gerdau's steel mill in Monroe today to see their expanded operations and hear from the hardworking men and women in the steel industry.
Great news: The House just passed significant reforms to modernize the GI Bill and help improve educational benefits for America’s veterans.

Flags in Michigan are at half-staff today in memory of Adrian Township Firefighter Allen Charles Howard who died last week while on duty. My prayers are with his family, friends, and entire department during this difficult time.
Today the House voted 419-3 to strengthen sanctions on Iran, Russia, and North Korea.
Self-driving vehicles present a promising and transformative future, and this bipartisan legislation outlines a roadmap for car manufacturers to develop, test, and safely bring them to market.
Today I introduced a bipartisan bill that promotes better conservation practices to protect Lake Erie and the entire Great Lakes ecosystem.

As their internships come to a close, a special thank you to David from Saline, Ben from Charlotte, and Mike from Ann Arbor for all their hard work on behalf of the 7th District. Click here if you're a student interested in learning more about an internship with my office: https://walberg.house.gov/services/internships
In Coldwater today to celebrate the grand opening of the new CFG Coldwater plant. It's an exciting day for jobs and investment in Branch County and the 7th District.

U.S. Army Pfc. James McCloughan, an Olivet College graduate and Michigan resident, will be awarded the Medal of Honor today for his life-saving bravery during the Vietnam War. It's a long-awaited and fitting tribute for a true American hero.
It was a true privilege to be at the Monroe County Fair today to present Vietnam veterans with their 50th anniversary pins.
Busy day across Monroe County, including speaking at the Rotary Club, visiting the YMCA, and meeting with Superintendent Julie Everly of Monroe Public Schools.

As a member of the House Committee on Energy and Commerce, we have been working on bipartisan legislation to boost medical innovation and bring new breakthrough treatments and cures to patients. After advancing the bill through the House, I'm glad to see it overwhelming pass the Senate today. Now the bill heads to the President's desk.
Thanks to W2Fuel in Adrian and RIMA Manufacturing in Hudson for showing me around your facilities today.

I'm very pleased to see Joan Larsen’s confirmation process finally moving forward. Joan is a brilliant legal scholar, revered by her colleagues, and an incredibly qualified candidate for the Sixth Circuit. I’m confident Joan’s sterling credentials will shine through during the Senate’s process, and once confirmed, she will continue to serve with distinction and stewardship of the Constitution on the federal bench.
Now that this report and its recommendations are public, it’s time to take this positive momentum and push forward long-term solutions to stop Asian carp from damaging the Great Lakes.
Thank you to everyone who joined us for today's coffee hours in Summit and Delta Townships. In Delta Township, I also toured Magna’s DexSys plant to see its expanded manufacturing facility.
Held two coffee hours in Dexter and Dundee today. Thanks to everyone who came out.

Thanks to everyone who joined me for coffee hour today at Southern Michigan Center for Science and Industry in Hudson. I also had the opportunity to tour their facility and discuss skills-focused educational opportunities.

Vern Ehlers was a very good man and a great legislator. He provided exemplary leadership for our state in the Michigan Legislature and in Congress, and it was a privilege to have served together. He will be missed. I wish his family my deepest sympathy and gratitude for sharing him with us.

Opioid addiction hits close to home for so many families and communities in Michigan. Yesterday, I joined with Rep. Debbie Dingell and Washtenaw Sheriff Jerry Clayton to hold a town hall discussion about combating the opioid crisis in Washtenaw County and across the state. Thank you to everyone who joined us for this important conversation. https://go.usa.gov/xRfc5
Good tour and discussion about agriculture issues today in Charlotte. Thanks to Gary Parr and the Michigan Soybean Association for hosting us.
Had a good meeting with the VA National Center for Patient Safety in Ann Arbor today to talk about ways to improve care for our veterans.
The high school football season is officially underway. It was great to be at the Big House today and do the coin toss for the Saline vs. Rockford game. Good luck this season!
As we enter the new school year, I welcome students to participate in this unique opportunity to have fun learning and enhance their skills for the future.

I'm hosting a Senior Fair in Eaton County on Wednesday to provide help with Social Security and Medicare difficulties, along with additional resources from area businesses and community partners. Click below for more details.

Thank you to Paladin Attachments for showing me around your manufacturing facility in Dexter yesterday. I enjoyed visiting with the dedicated men and women who work there and discussing ways to boost jobs and manufacturing in Michigan.

Great to see everyone at today’s Senior Resource Fair in Eaton County. Thanks to all the community organizations who were on hand and to my constituent relations team who provides assistance with Medicare and Social Security difficulties.

Today, on Overdose Awareness Day, I met with some community leaders in Lenawee County who are on the front lines confronting the opioid crisis. I also had the opportunity to visit the new Substance Abuse Engagement Center in Adrian, which is getting ready to open its doors in October.
Had a great time tonight at Dundee Community Schools celebrating the new school year and strategic plan. Wishing everyone a successful year.

Had a good discussion with Monroe County farmers yesterday at Heck Farms. One of the items we discussed was my bipartisan bill that encourages conservation and stewardship of the Great Lakes. https://go.usa.gov/xRHrD
Rep. Debbie Dingell and I are co-hosting a Veterans Fair in Washtenaw County on Monday to help veterans and their families learn more about resources available to them. Click below for more details.
Sixteen years later, we pause and remember the fallen and the sacrifice of our nation's heroes. May we #NeverForget.
Big news: My bipartisan amendment to rein in civil forfeiture abuse and protect property rights just passed the House.
It was an honor to join with the USO this week to assemble care packages for military personnel assisting with Harvey and Irma relief efforts.

Had a good discussion today with the Jackson County Chamber of Commerce about tax reform and helping small businesses thrive. We're working to simplify the tax code and unleash the growth of jobs and paychecks in Michigan. Learn more here: https://fairandsimple.gop/?utm_source=reptimwalberg

Join Rep. Debbie Dingell and me, along with local veterans organizations, for a community conversation on Monday at Washtenaw Community College. The event will provide an opportunity for veterans and their families to ask questions and receive information about the benefits and services available to them.
Happy Constitution Day! Today we celebrate the 230th anniversary of our nation’s founding document and the freedoms it affords us as Americans.

We had a great day helping veterans and their families and connecting them with available resources. Rep. Debbie Dingell and I co-hosted a Veterans Resource Fair at VFW Post 423, and then we participated in a town hall conversation on veterans health care at Washtenaw Community College. Thanks to the many veterans organizations who helped make both events such a success.
Productive day of meetings across Monroe County, including touring the Port of Monroe, visiting with Monroe Kiwanis, and talking with local leaders on the front lines combating drug addiction.
Thanks to Gary Whittaker for your hospitality and showing me around Three Cedars Farm in Salem Township this week.

North Korea's dangerous and provocative behavior continues to threaten global security, while also trampling the rights of the North Korean people. As sanctions ramp up, the House passed bipartisan legislation tonight to promote human rights, freedom of information, and help counter the Kim regime's propaganda.
So glad to see Matt Mika, my friend and former staff member, back on his feet and recovering after the shooting at the congressional baseball practice.

STEM education is increasingly important to prepare students for jobs in the 21st century workforce. Encouraged by today's announcement from auto and tech leaders boosting these efforts in the classroom.

The tax code is an unfair and complex mess that hasn’t been overhauled in 31 years. The framework released today begins the process of simplifying the tax code and allowing hard-working, middle class families in Michigan to keep more of what they earn.
Incredibly grateful to welcome Congressman Steve Scalise back to work today. What an answer to prayer.
Happy National Coffee Day! Had fun celebrating and hearing from constituents at Agua Dulce in Monroe.
Grateful to all the organizations who organized and attended today's Veteran Stand Down in Monroe. It was a privilege to participate in a Vietnam veteran pinning ceremony and honor military spouses.
Our hearts are broken by the horrific shooting in Las Vegas. As the nation mourns, we lift up in prayer the victims, their loved ones, and those still fighting for their lives.

The recent Equifax data breach affected millions of Americans and consumers deserve to know how this happened. Today the House Committee on Energy and Commerce will be questioning the former CEO of Equifax to get answers and hold them accountable.  To watch the hearing live, click here: https://go.usa.gov/xn3dr.  For helpful resources on protecting your identity and reporting identiy theft, visit IdentityTheft.gov.
Wrote a column in the Jackson Citizen Patriot about my bipartisan work to ensure our nation's heroes receive the care and benefits worthy of their service.

Excited to tour the Center for Manufacturing Excellence that just opened this week at Lansing Community College. It's a tremendous facility and resource for students to gain hands-on experience and skills.

On National Manufacturing Day, we celebrate the hardworking men and women who make high quality, American-made products. And we celebrate the manufacturers who provide more than 600,000 jobs in Michigan, drive our economy, and contribute to our communities. #MFGDay17

Larry and Sherry Majewski of Lambertville are a remarkable couple who have opened their hearts and home to eight wonderful children. The Angels in Adoption award could not go to a more deserving family.
Thanks to Alro Steel for showing me around your facility in Potterville today. It was great to meet the team and discuss ways to boost Michigan jobs and manufacturing.

Join us on Monday at Monroe High School to learn more about educational opportunities at U.S. military service academies. Students and parents are encouraged to attend to meet with academy representatives and discuss the application process.
I am testifying today before the Energy and Commerce Committee about Jessie's Law and our bipartisan work to combat the opioid crisis in our communities.

America’s small businesses and the millions of workers they employ are in desperate need of more affordable health care options. Empowering small businesses to band together through association health plans will help them provide better health care coverage at a lower cost for their workers.
A grateful nation says thank you to the men and women of the U.S. Navy who have served our country with bravery and valor.  Happy 242nd birthday!

At an Energy and Commerce Committee hearing this week, I joined with a bipartisan group of representatives to discuss legislative solutions to the opioid crisis. I testified about my bipartisan bill, Jessie’s Law, and shared stories from recent constituent meetings in Monroe and Lenawee Counties.

Thank you to everyone who joined us at today's coffee hour in Tecumseh. We covered many important issues, including our tax reform framework that will lower taxes, grow jobs, and increase take-home pay for middle class families. Learn more here: https://fairandsimple.gop/?utm_source=reptimwalberg

We had a great event yesterday at Monroe High School with students, parents, and representatives from the U.S. military service academies. Inspired to see so many young people interested in serving our country.

The deadline to submit an app for the Congressional App Challenge is just two weeks away. It is an unique opportunity for students to showcase their creativity and STEM talents. More details here: https://go.usa.gov/xnr5q
Why tax reform? It will grow jobs, raise wages, and keep more money in your pocket. Learn more about our plan: https://fairandsimple.gop

This Saturday is National Prescription Drug Take Back Day. Locations across Michigan's 7th District will serve as collection sites for the safe disposal of expired or unwanted prescription drugs. More details here: go.usa.gov/xnY6S
I'm hosting a Veterans Resource Fair in Jackson on Monday to help veterans and their families file for VA benefits and services. Click below for more details.

Just returned from the White House where President Trump declared the opioid epidemic a public health emergency. Heroin and opioid addiction is devastating the dreams of people we know and love, and tackling this crisis must be a national priority.

This week I introduced a bipartisan bill to help make it easier for small businesses to offer retirement plans while keeping fees down for employees. It is a commonsense step in our efforts to empower every American to retire with financial security and peace of mind.

Stopped by the Center for Family Health in Jackson for National Prescription Drug Take Back Day. Thank you to County Prosecutor Jerry Jarzynka, the Substance Abuse Prevention Coalition, and local law enforcement for organizing this service and all your work fighting the opioid crisis in our community.
Congrats to Adrian College on your new state-of-the-art medical studies facility.
Lifting up in prayer the victims and their families of today's evil act of terrorism in New York City. Americans are a resilient people, and in times of tragedy, we stand together.
Thank you to everyone who attended one of our recent coffee hours in Spring Arbor, Grand Ledge, and Monroe.

The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act was introduced today. It's about lowering the tax burden on Michigan families and small businesses, and providing a pay raise to the workers who need it most. You can read the bill at https://fairandsimple.gop.

Today the House passed bipartisan legislation to support the Children’s Health Insurance Program, community health centers, and other public health priorities important to children and families in Michigan.
We had a great Veterans Resource Fair today in Jackson to assist veterans and their families. Thanks to the many veterans organizations who participated and helped make it a success.
An inspiring story about Jude Stamper from Monroe. He'll make a great addition to the Michigan basketball team.

Morgan Scarbro from Eaton Rapids has a heart for helping veterans, our military, and their families. She's 14-years-old and created a non-profit called Morgan’s Hugs. If there is a veteran in need, Morgan springs into action.
As we observe Veterans Day this weekend, it was a privilege to spend time at the Ann Arbor VA today to honor and pay tribute to our nation's veterans. We can't say thank you enough.
Wonderful ceremony in Bedford Township to dedicate their veterans memorial and recognize those who served.
It was an honor to be a part of Luna Pier's Veterans Day program to pay tribute to our nation's heroes. Thank you for your service and sacrifice.

What a moving Veterans Day event last night in Springport to honor Vietnam-era veterans with their 50th anniversary lapel pins. It was also a privilege to present a Purple Heart and service medals to the family of U.S. Army Sergeant Kenneth W. Parker, who was declared Missing in Action while fighting in the Korean War in 1952.
Met with Vicky Loveland and members of the Monroe County Substance Abuse Coalition today to discuss ways to tackle the heroin and opioid epidemic. Grateful for their work in the community.
The current civil asset forfeiture system is ripe for abuse and I'll keep fighting for reforms.
Great news: The House just passed a strong bipartisan defense bill to enhance our national security and give our troops a pay raise.
Enjoyed visiting with a great group of high school students from Dundee Community Schools today as part of their Close Up trip to our nation's capital.

The tax code has been hurting our economy and families in Michigan for too long. The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act, which passed the House today, is geared towards giving middle-income families a break, increasing take-home pay, and putting more money in people’s pockets. It’s about more jobs and bigger paychecks for the workers who need it most.
Congrats to the Bronson volleyball team on winning three consecutive state championships. Incredible accomplishment.

Today I toured IMPCO, a machine tool shop in Lansing, with Rep. Mike Bishop and Rep. Paul Mitchell. We discussed the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act and how it will help Michigan manufacturing, create more jobs, and raise wages for workers.

Great to be in Litchfield today to tour the Hi-Lex Controls expansion. The new facility is set to begin operations in 2018 and means more jobs and investment in the community. I also stopped by the Litchfield Regional Training Center, which provides important skills-based educational opportunities to prepare people for in-demand technical careers.

It was a privilege to recognize the Bronson volleyball team today for capturing their third straight state championship. The Lady Vikings' outstanding teamwork and season have made their hometown proud.
As a Harley owner who has been riding since my 20th birthday, it's an honor to receive this national award.
Had fun visiting Michigan Football practice today as they get ready for The Game on Saturday.
Two high school football teams from our district took home state championships today. Congrats to Lumen Christi Catholic School and Whiteford Agricultural Schools on impressive seasons!
We have so many great small businesses here in Michigan. On Small Business Saturday, remember to shop small and support our local economy.

Mary Smith was like family to so many of us in Branch County, and I am saddened to learn that she passed away over the weekend at the age of 102. She was always involved, always giving back, and always a passionate advocate for bettering the community. Mary’s lifelong service to Coldwater, particularly her leadership to restore the Tibbits Opera House, will forever be remembered. Mary was committed to living life to the fullest, and at the age of 96, was one of the best passengers to ever ride on my Harley. Sue and I are praying for the entire Smith family as we mourn her loss and remember a life well lived.
Thanks to everyone who came out to today's coffee hour in Charlotte.

I had the privilege of meeting Bill Gibbs at VFW Post 6056 in Springport a couple weeks ago during their Veterans Day ceremony. Bill has served our country and community in so many ways, and he is incredibly deserving of the Jackson County Veteran of the Year award.
Today the House passed bipartisan legislation to help revitalize industrial sites, encourage job growth, and bring about economic benefits for our communities.
Thanks to everyone who joined us in Frenchtown Charter Township yesterday for coffee hour.
The lighting of the Capitol Christmas tree took place tonight. Looking forward to a busy but joyful holiday season.
Today, we remember Pearl Harbor and honor those who lost their lives on December 7, 1941.

At today's Energy and Commerce Subcommittee hearing, I pressed EPA Administrator Pruitt about protecting the Great Lakes, including supporting the Great Lakes Restoration Initiative, combating harmful algal blooms on Lake Erie, and stopping invasive species like Asian Carp. https://go.usa.gov/xnNr4

It was a joy to meet with the Bignell family from Reading this week and hear about their heart for orphans in need of loving families. They adopted two sons from Ethiopia and are now facing a long process of adopting two more.
NA

This is important legislation for our men and women in uniform, and I am glad the President signed it into law today. It will strengthen our military readiness and give our troops their largest pay raise in eight years.
So many great things happening at the Boys & Girls Club of Lenawee this holiday season and throughout the year. Thanks for the update and to Alexis for the special Christmas card!

This week we are voting on the final conference agreement between the House and Senate on the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. Michigan families and small businesses need tax relief, and this bill will help them keep more of what they earn. Read more about the agreement here: https://go.usa.gov/xnQfy

Today’s vote is a pivotal moment for hardworking families in Michigan who need a break. For the first time in three decades, we are overhauling the code to reduce the burden on taxpayers and revitalize our economy.

In cities and towns throughout the 7th District, I've repeatedly heard the need for tax relief for hardworking families and small businesses who need a break. All along, I've fought for boosting their take-home pay and pocketbooks. Our bill delivers on the promise to provide real relief and a brighter future.
Tackling the opioid crisis, organizing veterans fairs, helping job seekers, solving casework issues. 2017 has been a busy year in the 7th District.

As 2017 comes to a close, I wanted to update you on the progress we made this year. I was proud to lead the way on a number of important issues like combating human trafficking, protecting retirement security, and making energy more affordable.
Hamburgers on the grill for Christmas Eve lunch. Let it snow!
Merry Christmas to you and your family! May it be filled with hope, joy, and special moments with those you love.
Before we count down to the new year, take a look back at some highlights of what's been a productive year serving you in Congress.
Some of the Walberg clan at the Adrian College ice rink.
